#R

library(ggplot2)

Values <- read.table("/Users/markobajic/Desktop/THSreportingPaper/AnnotatedPeaks/MT-ALL-Numbers.txt", header=T, sep="\t", check.names=F)
SUM <- sum(Values$Number)
Values$Number <- (Values$Number)/SUM
Values$GenomicFeature <- factor(Values$GenomicFeature, levels = Values$GenomicFeature)
ggplot(Values, aes(x="", y=Number, fill=GenomicFeature), clockwise=TRUE) + geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1) + coord_polar("y", start=0, direction=-1) + scale_fill_manual(values=c("deepskyblue", "#F26419", "#F6AE2D", "forestgreen", "#999999")) + labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, fill = NULL, title = "Genomic Distribution") + theme_classic() + theme(axis.line = element_blank(), axis.text = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank(), plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, color = "#666666")) + geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Number*100), "%")), position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))
dev.copy(pdf,'MT-ALL-PieChart.pdf')
dev.off()



Values <- read.table("/Users/markobajic/Desktop/THSreportingPaper/AnnotatedPeaks/MT-UP-Numbers.txt", header=T, sep="\t", check.names=F)
SUM <- sum(Values$Number)
Values$Number <- (Values$Number)/SUM
Values$GenomicFeature <- factor(Values$GenomicFeature, levels = Values$GenomicFeature)

dev.copy(pdf,'MT-UP-PieChart.pdf')
dev.off()

Values <- read.table("/Users/markobajic/Desktop/THSreportingPaper/AnnotatedPeaks/SL-SHOOT-UP-Numbers.txt", header=T, sep="\t", check.names=F)
SUM <- sum(Values$Number)
Values$Number <- (Values$Number)/SUM
Values$GenomicFeature <- factor(Values$GenomicFeature, levels = Values$GenomicFeature)
ggplot(Values, aes(x="", y=Number, fill=GenomicFeature), clockwise=TRUE) + geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1) + coord_polar("y", start=0, direction=-1) + scale_fill_manual(values=c("deepskyblue", "#F26419", "#F6AE2D", "forestgreen", "#999999")) + labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, fill = NULL, title = "Genomic Distribution") + theme_classic() + theme(axis.line = element_blank(), axis.text = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank(), plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, color = "#666666")) + geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Number*100), "%")), position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))
dev.copy(pdf,'SL-SHOOT-UP-PieChart.pdf')
dev.off()

Values <- read.table("/Users/markobajic/Desktop/THSreportingPaper/AnnotatedPeaks/SL-SHOOT-DOWN-Numbers.txt", header=T, sep="\t", check.names=F)
SUM <- sum(Values$Number)

annotatePeaks.pl SL-HAIRY-Down-merged50p.bed /Users/markobajic/Desktop/SUBEXP-DESeq-Results/ANNOTATION/S_lycopersicum_chromosomes.3.00.fa -ann /Users/markobajic/Desktop/SUBEXP-DESeq-Results/ANNOTATION/AnnotationTables/SL-UseThisAnnotationTable.txt > AnnotatedPeaks/SL-HAIRY-DOWN-Annotated.txt;

annotatePeaks.pl SP-ROOT-Up-merged50p.bed /Users/markobajic/Desktop/SUBEXP-DESeq-Results/ANNOTATION/Spenn.fasta -ann /Users/markobajic/Desktop/SUBEXP-DESeq-Results/ANNOTATION/AnnotationTables/SP-UseThisAnnotationTable-DASHED.txt > AnnotatedPeaks/SP-ROOT-UP-Annotated.txt;

cd /Users/markobajic/Desktop/THSreportingPaper/AnnotatedPeaks; 

less SL-HAIRY-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "promoter-TSS" | awk '{print $1"\t""Promoter"}' > number1.txt; 
less SL-HAIRY-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "exon" | awk '{print $1"\t""Exon"}' > number2.txt; 
less SL-HAIRY-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "intron" | awk '{print $1"\t""Intron"}' > number3.txt; 
less SL-HAIRY-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "TTS" | awk '{print $1"\t""Downstream"}' > number4.txt; 
less SL-HAIRY-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "Intergenic" | awk '{print $1"\t""Intergenic"}' > number5.txt; 
cat number1.txt number2.txt number3.txt number4.txt number5.txt | awk '{print $2"\t"$1}' | awk 'BEGIN{print "GenomicFeature""\t""Number"};{print}' > SL-HAIRY-UP-Numbers.txt; 
rm number*.txt; 

less SL-HAIRY-DOWN-Annotated.txt | grep -c "promoter-TSS" | awk '{print $1"\t""Promoter"}' > number1.txt; 
less SL-HAIRY-DOWN-Annotated.txt | grep -c "exon" | awk '{print $1"\t""Exon"}' > number2.txt; 
less SL-HAIRY-DOWN-Annotated.txt | grep -c "intron" | awk '{print $1"\t""Intron"}' > number3.txt; 
less SL-HAIRY-DOWN-Annotated.txt | grep -c "TTS" | awk '{print $1"\t""Downstream"}' > number4.txt; 
less SL-HAIRY-DOWN-Annotated.txt | grep -c "Intergenic" | awk '{print $1"\t""Intergenic"}' > number5.txt; 
cat number1.txt number2.txt number3.txt number4.txt number5.txt | awk '{print $2"\t"$1}' | awk 'BEGIN{print "GenomicFeature""\t""Number"};{print}' > SL-HAIRY-DOWN-Numbers.txt; 
rm number*.txt; 
 

less SL-ROOT-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "promoter-TSS" | awk '{print $1"\t""Promoter"}' > number1.txt; 
less SL-ROOT-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "exon" | awk '{print $1"\t""Exon"}' > number2.txt; 
less SL-ROOT-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "intron" | awk '{print $1"\t""Intron"}' > number3.txt; 
less SL-ROOT-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "TTS" | awk '{print $1"\t""Downstream"}' > number4.txt; 
less SL-ROOT-UP-Annotated.txt | grep -c "Intergenic" | awk '{print $1"\t""Intergenic"}' > number5.txt; 
cat number1.txt number2.txt number3.txt number4.txt number5.txt | awk '{print $2"\t"$1}' | awk 'BEGIN{print "GenomicFeature""\t""Number"};{print}' > SL-ROOT-UP-Numbers.txt; 
rm number*.txt

less SL-ROOT-DOWN-Annotated.txt | grep -c "promoter-TSS" | awk '{print $1"\t""Promoter"}' > number1.txt; 
less SL-ROOT-DOWN-Annotated.txt | grep -c "exon" | awk '{print $1"\t""Exon"}' > number2.txt;

less SL-ROOT-DOWN-Annotated.txt | grep -c "Intergenic" | awk '{print $1"\t""Intergenic"}' > number5.txt; 
cat number1.txt number2.txt number3.txt number4.txt number5.txt | awk '{print $2"\t"$1}' | awk 'BEGIN{print "GenomicFeature""\t""Number"};{print}' > SL-ROOT-DOWN-Numbers.txt; 
rm number*.txt;

#R

library(ggplot2)


Values <- read.table("/Users/markobajic/Desktop/THSreportingPaper/AnnotatedPeaks/SL-HAIRY-UP-Numbers.txt", header=T, sep="\t", check.names=F)
SUM <- sum(Values$Number)
Values$Number <- (Values$Number)/SUM
Values$GenomicFeature <- factor(Values$GenomicFeature, levels = Values$GenomicFeature)
ggplot(Values, aes(x="", y=Number, fill=GenomicFeature), clockwise=TRUE) + geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1) + coord_polar("y", start=0, direction=-1) + scale_fill_manual(values=c("deepskyblue", "#F26419", "#F6AE2D", "forestgreen", "#999999")) + labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, fill = NULL, title = "Genomic Distribution") + theme_classic() + theme(axis.line = element_blank(), axis.text = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank(), plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, color = "#666666")) + geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Number*100), "%")), position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))
dev.copy(pdf,'SL-HAIRY-UP-PieChart.pdf')
dev.off()

Values <- read.table("/Users/markobajic/Desktop/THSreportingPaper/AnnotatedPeaks/SL-HAIRY-DOWN-Numbers.txt", header=T, sep="\t", check.names=F)
SUM <- sum(Values$Number)
Values$Number <- (Values$Number)/SUM
Values$GenomicFeature <- factor(Values$GenomicFeature, levels = Values$GenomicFeature)
ggplot(Values, aes(x="", y=Number, fill=GenomicFeature), clockwise=TRUE) + geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1) + coord_polar("y", start=0, direction=-1) + scale_fill_manual(values=c("deepskyblue", "#F26419", "#F6AE2D", "forestgreen", "#999999")) + labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, fill = NULL, title = "Genomic Distribution") + theme_classic() + theme(axis.line = element_blank(), axis.text = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank(), plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, color = "#666666")) + geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Number*100), "%")), position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))
dev.copy(pdf,'SL-HAIRY-DOWN-PieChart.pdf')
dev.off()


Values <- read.table("/Users/markobajic/Desktop/THSreportingPaper/AnnotatedPeaks/SL-ROOT-UP-Numbers.txt", header=T, sep="\t", check.names=F)
SUM <- sum(Values$Number)

dev.copy(pdf,'SL-ROOT-UP-PieChart.pdf')
dev.off()

Values <- read.table("/Users/markobajic/Desktop/THSreportingPaper/AnnotatedPeaks/SL-ROOT-DOWN-Numbers.txt", header=T, sep="\t", check.names=F)
SUM <- sum(Values$Number)
Values$Number <- (Values$Number)/SUM
Values$GenomicFeature <- factor(Values$GenomicFeature, levels = Values$GenomicFeature)
ggplot(Values, aes(x="", y=Number, fill=GenomicFeature), clockwise=TRUE) + geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1) + coord_polar("y", start=0, direction=-1) + scale_fill_manual(values=c("deepskyblue", "#F26419", "#F6AE2D", "forestgreen", "#999999")) + labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, fill = NULL, title = "Genomic Distribution") + theme_classic() + theme(axis.line = element_blank(), axis.text = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank(), plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, color = "#666666")) + geom_text(aes(label = paste0(round(Number*100), "%")), position = position_stack(vjust = 0.5))
dev.copy(pdf,'SL-ROOT-DOWN-PieChart.pdf')
dev.off()

awk '{print $7}' MT-Up-PromResults.txt | awk '!x[$0]++' > MT-Up-Prom-Genes.bed;

Command for using column 1 of file 1 to look up matched lines in column 2 of file 2 and print out the matched lines from file 2 into file 3 is:

awk 'FNR==NR { a[$1]; next } ($2 in a)' file1.txt file2.txt > file3.txt; 

You can change which columns the query is in and which column the matched values will be but with some testing I think it is best to have the query in column 1 of file 1.

The main reason this command is preferable to doing vlookup in Excel is because it will return ALL matched lines for a given query whereas vlookup will only return 1, the first, matched value.



When you want to print out only a specific set of tabs from a file, here they are columns 3 4 and 5, and they are tab separated, the command is:

awk 'NR>1 {print $3"\t"$4"\t"$5}' filewithlotsoftabs.txt > filewithonlythespecifictabs.bed; 

You can easily change which columns to print out by specifying with $number but the real key is if you want the results to be tab separated you specify with "\t"



Did some quick googling and found a command that after some testing is really useful for processing data mathematically. What this essentially does is, for the example given, replaces column 4 of the input file with the result of the value in column 5 divided by value in column 4. Before creating the output, a pipe if used for another awk command so that we keep only the columns we care about, which is not column 5, so we keep everything else, and it is tab separated.

awk '{$4 = $5 / $4}1' inputfile.txt | awk '{print $1"\t"$2"\t"$3"\t"$4"\t"$6"\t"$7"\t"$8}' > outputfile.bed


A simpler example of this is if you had a file with just two columns of values and wanted to divide you would do this:

awk '{$1 = $2 / $1}1' testing.txt | awk '{print $1}' > outputfile.bed

The whole thing here is that you would end up with just the results, but for the specific DNA methylation example you described it seems like you want the coordinate information as well as the methylation value, which the more complicated example describes better



Also, if you ever want to plot the frequency distribution (y-axis) of some values (x-axis) you can easily do this in Terminal by quickly dipping into R. The end result will be a png file of the histogram plot saved in the directory you were working in.

R

SomeName <- read.table("Path/To/File/FileWithValuesToBePlottedAsAFrequencyOfOccurrence.bed", header = F, sep = "\t", check.names = F) 

AnotherName <- SomeName$V1

hist(AnotherName,breaks=4000, freq=NULL, main = paste("Title For The Plot"), xlab = "bp")
dev.copy(png,'NameForPngFileOfThePlot.png')
dev.off()
















#OK, well the stuff below did NOT yield a god method for doing this... such weird formatting stuffs


cd /Users/markobajic/Desktop/Genomes/Visualization; 

computeMatrix scale-regions -S OS-HRPE-WG.bw OS-bHLH-WG.bw OS-MYB-WG.bw OS-WRKY-WG.bw -R OS-Genes.bed -a 0 -b 2000 -m 1000 -o OS-Genes-4Motifs.gz; 
computeMatrix scale-regions -S MT-HRPE-WG.bw MT-bHLH-WG.bw MT-MYB-WG.bw MT-WRKY-WG.bw -R MT-Genes.bed -a 0 -b 2000 -m 1000 -o MT-Genes-4Motifs.gz; 
computeMatrix scale-regions -S SL-HRPE-WG.bw SL-bHLH-WG.bw SL-MYB-WG.bw SL-WRKY-WG.bw -R SL-Genes.bed -a 0 -b 2000 -m 1000 -o SL-Genes-4Motifs.gz; 
computeMatrix scale-regions -S SP-HRPE-WG.bw SP-bHLH-WG.bw SP-MYB-WG.bw SP-WRKY-WG.bw -R SP-Genes.bed -a 0 -b 2000 -m 1000 -o SP-Genes-4Motifs.gz; 
computeMatrix scale-regions -S AF-HRPE-WG.bw AF-bHLH-WG.bw AF-MYB-WG.bw AF-WRKY-WG.bw -R AF-Genes.bed -a 0 -b 2000 -m 1000 -o AF-Genes-4Motifs.gz; 
computeMatrix scale-regions -S PP-HRPE-WG.bw PP-bHLH-WG.bw PP-MYB-WG.bw PP-WRKY-WG.bw -R PP-Genes.bed -a 0 -b 2000 -m 1000 -o PP-Genes-4Motifs.gz; 
computeMatrix scale-regions -S SC-HRPE-WG.bw SC-bHLH-WG.bw SC-MYB-WG.bw SC-WRKY-WG.bw -R SC-Genes.bed -a 0 -b 2000 -m 1000 -o SC-Genes-4Motifs.gz; 

plotHeatmap -m OS-Genes-4Motifs.gz --startLabel TSS --zMin 0 0 0 0 --zMax 0.1 0.1 0.1 0.1 --endLabel TES --xAxisLabel bp --regionsLabel OSAllgenes --missingDataColor white --samplesLabel HRPE bHLH MYB WRKY -out OS-Genes-4Motifs.pdf --legendLocation upper-right --colorList 'white,lightgrey,red' 'white,lightgrey,yellow' 'white,lightgrey,blue' 'white,lightgrey,green' --dpi 300 --boxAroundHeatmaps no; 
plotHeatmap -m MT-Genes-4Motifs.gz --startLabel TSS --zMin 0 0 0 0 --endLabel TES --xAxisLabel bp --regionsLabel MTAllgenes --missingDataColor white --hclust 1 --samplesLabel HRPE bHLH MYB WRKY -out MT-Genes-4Motifs.pdf --legendLocation upper-right --colorList 'white,lightgrey,red' 'white,lightgrey,yellow' 'white,lightgrey,blue' 'white,lightgrey,green' --dpi 300 --boxAroundHeatmaps no; 
plotHeatmap -m SL-Genes-4Motifs.gz --startLabel TSS --zMin 0 0 0 0 --endLabel TES --xAxisLabel bp --regionsLabel SLAllgenes --missingDataColor white --hclust 1 --samplesLabel HRPE bHLH MYB WRKY -out SL-Genes-4Motifs.pdf --legendLocation upper-right --colorList 'white,lightgrey,red' 'white,lightgrey,yellow' 'white,lightgrey,blue' 'white,lightgrey,green' --dpi 300 --boxAroundHeatmaps no; 
plotHeatmap -m SP-Genes-4Motifs.gz --startLabel TSS --zMin 0 0 0 0 --endLabel TES --xAxisLabel bp --regionsLabel SPAllgenes --missingDataColor white --hclust 1 --samplesLabel HRPE bHLH MYB WRKY -out SP-Genes-4Motifs.pdf --legendLocation upper-right --colorList 'white,lightgrey,red' 'white,lightgrey,yellow' 'white,lightgrey,blue' 'white,lightgrey,green' --dpi 300 --boxAroundHeatmaps no; 
plotHeatmap -m AF-Genes-4Motifs.gz --startLabel TSS --zMin 0 0 0 0 --endLabel TES --xAxisLabel bp --regionsLabel AFAllgenes --missingDataColor white --hclust 1 --samplesLabel HRPE bHLH MYB WRKY -out AF-Genes-4Motifs.pdf --legendLocation upper-right --colorList 'white,lightgrey,red' 'white,lightgrey,yellow' 'white,lightgrey,blue' 'white,lightgrey,green' --dpi 300 --boxAroundHeatmaps no; 
plotHeatmap -m PP-Genes-4Motifs.gz --startLabel TSS --zMin 0 0 0 0 --endLabel TES --xAxisLabel bp --regionsLabel PPAllgenes --missingDataColor white --hclust 1 --samplesLabel HRPE bHLH MYB WRKY -out PP-Genes-4Motifs.pdf --legendLocation upper-right --colorList 'white,lightgrey,red' 'white,lightgrey,yellow' 'white,lightgrey,blue' 'white,lightgrey,green' --dpi 300 --boxAroundHeatmaps no; 
plotHeatmap -m SC-Genes-4Motifs.gz --startLabel TSS --zMin 0 0 0 0 --endLabel TES --xAxisLabel bp --regionsLabel ASCllgenes --missingDataColor white --hclust 1 --samplesLabel HRPE bHLH MYB WRKY -out SC-Genes-4Motifs.pdf --legendLocation upper-right --colorList 'white,lightgrey,red' 'white,lightgrey,yellow' 'white,lightgrey,blue' 'white,lightgrey,green' --dpi 300 --boxAroundHeatmaps no; 
cp *-Genes-4Motifs.pdf Plots; 













cd /Users/markobajic/Desktop/MotifEnrichment-NetworkApproach/tFIMO/WHOLEgenomeSEQs/MT/Coordinates; 

bedtools intersect -wa -a HRPE-MT-WG.bed -b MT-All.bed > int.bed; awk '!x[$0]++' int.bed | awk '{print $1"-"$2"-"$3}' > HRPE-MT-All-IDd.bed; rm int.bed; 
bedtools intersect -wa -a bHLH-MT-WG.bed -b MT-All.bed > int.bed; awk '!x[$0]++' int.bed | awk '{print $1"-"$2"-"$3}' > bHLH-MT-All-IDd.bed; rm int.bed; 
bedtools intersect -wa -a MYB-MT-WG.bed -b MT-All.bed > int.bed; awk '!x[$0]++' int.bed | awk '{print $1"-"$2"-"$3}' > MYB-MT-All-IDd.bed; rm int.bed; 
bedtools intersect -wa -a WRKYcore-MT-WG.bed -b MT-All.bed > int.bed; awk '!x[$0]++' int.bed | awk '{print $1"-"$2"-"$3}' > WRKY-MT-All-IDd.bed; rm int.bed; 

cp HRPE-MT-All-IDd.bed /Users/markobajic/Desktop; 
cp bHLH-MT-All-IDd.bed /Users/markobajic/Desktop; 
cp MYB-MT-All-IDd.bed /Users/markobajic/Desktop; 
cp WRKY-MT-All-IDd.bed /Users/markobajic/Desktop;
